page.title: 13Shops in King's Sutton
page.content: For a village of its size King's Sutton still has a surprising number of shops. There are four general food stores, as well as a butcher. One of these stores is an off-licence and another sells newspapers and magazines. There is also a Post Office with D-I-Y goods,a hair-dresser's and a shop which sells things like wool. Most people in King's Sutton try to support the local shops and only those who prefer a good supermarket go to Banbury to buy food. If you cannot or do not want to walk to the shops there are mobile vans, which come round weekly, to help you. A fish and chips van which comes on Friday is popular and there is also a fresh fish van once a week.
